alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marion County through 300 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort McCoy, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort McCoy and Hog Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
